meanings.definition: The state or quality of being crummy.
meanings.sent1: The crumminesses of the old house was evident in its peeling paint and creaky floors.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand the crumminesses of the broken toy, with its missing pieces and chipped paint.
meanings.sent3: Despite its crumminesses, the little bakery on the corner always had the best cinnamon rolls.
meanings.sent4: The crumminesses of the situation weighed heavily on her, like a dark cloud hanging over her head.
meanings.sent5: The crumminesses of the abandoned factory made it seem like a haunted place from a ghost story.

meanings.sent1: The crumminesses of the old couch were evident in its torn upholstery and wobbly legs.
meanings.sent2: Living in such crumminesses was not ideal, but they made the best of their small apartment.
meanings.sent3: The crumminesses of the makeshift tent in the backyard made it a cozy hideout for the kids.
meanings.sent4: The crumminesses of the abandoned building gave it a mysterious and eerie vibe.
meanings.sent5: The crumminesses of the worn-out book added to its charm and history.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being inferior or of poor quality.
meanings.sent1: The crumminesses of the knock-off bag were obvious in its flimsy material and crooked stitching.
meanings.sent2: He refused to settle for the crumminesses of the cheap product and opted for better quality.
meanings.sent3: Despite the crumminesses of the old car, it had sentimental value to the family.
meanings.sent4: The crumminesses of the counterfeit painting were revealed under closer inspection.
meanings.sent5: The crumminesses of the bargain shoes became apparent after just a few wears.
